Headline: Global CEOs Meet Chinese Trade Negotiator as Tensions Linger
Summary: Global CEOs including Apple Inc.’s Tim Cook on Thursday met top trade Chinese negotiator He Lifeng in Beijing, a gathering that coincided with an uptick in trade tensions between China and the US.  The business executives are part of an advisory board for Tsinghua University’s School of Economics and Management that typically gathers every year and Cook is the chair of that committee.

Headline: TSMC profits blow past market forecast thanks to AI boom
Summary: STORY: :: TSMCChip giant TSMC posted a record-breaking third-quarter profit Thursday, up 39.1%, smashing market expectations.But looming U.S. tariffs could cloud its outlook.Riding the AI boom, the company reported a net profit of nearly $15 billion, marking its sixth straight quarter of double-digit growth.:: FileDemand from major players like Apple and Nvidia continues to boost its bottom line.The Taiwan firm says AI demand is still strengthening, and is higher now than it had expected only three months ago. That follows similarly robust outlooks from other major tech players, including South Korea's Samsung and European chip gear leader ASML - a big supplier to TSMC. Despite the strong results, uncertainty looms.U.S. tariffs imposed by Donald Trump's administration weigh on the outlook.:: TSMCStill, TSMC is pushing ahead with a $100 billion U.S. expansion.That's on top of $65 billion already pledged for three plants in Arizona, one already operational.:: File TSMC shares are up 38% this year, outpacing Taiwan’s broader market as investors so far shrug off the tariff risks.

Headline: TSMC Raises Outlook in Vote of Confidence for AI ‘Megatrend’
Summary: TSMC, the go-to chipmaker for Apple Inc. and  Nvidia Corp., now foresees mid-30% growth in annual sales, up about a few percentage points from previously.  The outlook hike was striking given Taiwan’s biggest company last raised its guidance just three months ago, igniting a rally that’s tacked on more than $260 billion to its market value.  The results underscore how TSMC remains one of the bigger beneficiaries of a spending spree on AI infrastructure that’s expected to cross the $1 trillion mark in coming years.

Headline: TSMC Hikes Sales Outlook Amid AI Boom
Summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. hiked its projection for 2025 revenue growth to the mid-30% range. The company also raised the lower end of its capital spending target for the year after reporting a better-than-anticipated 39% jump in profit in the September quarter. TSMC is the go-to chipmaker for Apple Inc. and most of the world's biggest semiconductor designers. The results show Taiwan's largest company remains one of the bigger beneficiaries of a spending spree on AI infrastructure. Bloomberg Intelligence's Matthew Bloxham breaks down the numbers.

Headline: AI boom delivers record net profit for Taiwan's TSMC
Summary: Taiwanese tech titan TSMC reported Thursday a record net profit for the third quarter on skyrocketing demand for microchips used to power iPhones and artificial intelligence.TSMC said net profit for the three months to September soared 39.1 percent from a year ago to NT$452.3 billion (US$14.7 billion), a quarterly record.

Headline: Taiwanese chipmaker TSMC sees nearly 40% jump in its net profit thanks to the AI boom
Summary: Taiwan’s leading computer chip maker, TSMC, said Thursday that its net profit surged nearly 40% in the last quarter, boosted by the surge in use of artificial intelligence.  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp. is the world’s biggest semiconductor manufacturer.  It reported a net profit of a record 452.3 billion new Taiwan dollars ($15 billion) in the July-September quarter, higher than analysts’ forecasts.

Headline: TSMC ADR Premium Tops Two-Decade High as Global Buyers Pile In
Summary: Its American depositary receipts are trading at the highest premium to its Taipei shares since 2002, on a 50-day moving average basis.  The ADRs have surged 54% this year, outpacing the 38% gain in the Taiwan listing, as global traders boost bullish bets.  “We are positive on TSMC’s outlook and expect it to raise its full-year 2025 sales growth outlook,” said Rex Chen, a Taipei-based fund manager at Capital Investment Trust Corp.

Headline: Trump hosts glitzy dinner for wealthy donors to new White House ballroom
Summary: President Donald Trump on Wednesday welcomed nearly 130 deep-pocketed donors, allies and representatives of major companies for a dinner at the White House to reward them for their pledged contributions to a massive new ballroom.  The ballroom, whose price tag is now estimated at $250 million, is the most significant renovation that Trump, a former real estate mogul, is undertaking during his second term at the White House.  All four sides of the ballroom — which Trump said will be large and grand enough to hold even a presidential inauguration -- will be made of bulletproof glass, with its color, window shape and molding keeping in character with the White House.

Headline: Omdia: Mainland China’s Smartphone Market Declined 3% in 3Q25 as Vivo Regained Top Position Amid Intensifying Competition
Summary: LONDON, October 16, 2025--According to Omdia’s latest research, mainland China’s smartphone market declined 3% year on year in 3Q25. The market remains in an adjustment phase, while competition among leading vendors has intensified, with shipment gaps between the top players continuing to narrow. vivo regained the top spot with shipments of 11.8 million units, accounting for an 18% market share.
